org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.robotplus.hardware

Class MecanumDrive

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.robotplus.hardware.Drivetrain
      • org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.robotplus.hardware.MecanumDrive

  • public class MecanumDrive
extends Drivetrain
    General-use Mecanum drivetrain class for use throughout OpModes. Use if your robot is using a mecanum drivetrain, in conjunction with the robot class and other hardware classes.
    Since:
    8/24/17

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MecanumDrive()
      Creates empty Mecanum Drive (only with motor types set to 60)
      MecanumDrive(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.DcMotor main1, com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.DcMotor main2, com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.DcMotor minor1, com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.DcMotor minor2)
      Create a mecanum drive from four individual motors
      MecanumDrive(MotorPair mainDiagonal, MotorPair minorDiagonal)
      Creates Mecanum Drive from two pairs of motors going in the same diagonals

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void arcadeDrive(double x, double y)
      Take in gamepad values corresponding to the direction you need the robot to move, and move in that direction without rotating.

      Return the MotorPair for the motors going top left to bottom right

      Return the MotorPair for the motors going top right to bottom left

      Resets the motor's encoder values (and sets them to use encoders)

      Sets the MotorPair corresponding to the motors going top left to bottom right

      sets the MotorPair corresponding to the motors going top right to bottom left
      void setModes(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.DcMotor.RunMode runMode)
      Sets all motors in the drivetrain to one mode
      void setPower(double power)
      Sets all motors power's to one value
      void stopMoving()
      Sets all powers for everything to 0, stopping everything.

                    com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.DcMotor minor2)
        Create a mecanum drive from four individual motors
        Parameters:
        main1 - A motor in the top left to bottom right diagonal
        main2 - A motor in the top left to bottom right diagonal
        minor1 - A motor in the top right to bottom left diagonal
        minor2 - A motor in the top right to bottom left diagonal

    • Method Detail

      • arcadeDrive

        public void arcadeDrive(double x,
                        double y)
        Take in gamepad values corresponding to the direction you need the robot to move, and move in that direction without rotating. Works from joystick x and ys.
        Parameters:
        x - The x value of the joystick
        y - The y value of the joystick
